channel.title: Programmings on What's Behind
channel.description: Recent content in Programmings on What's Behind

item.title: Set Up Hugo in Git Hub Pages
item.description: Create a repository to hold the source code of your blogs Create a repository of Git Hub Pages Create a new Hugo project in your local machine cd ~/Projects hugo new site <site name> cd <site name> git init git remote add origin <repository URL of your blogs> git add . git commit -m "Initiate a new hugo project" git push origin main Choose theme for your blog site Navigate to Hugo theme website Down your favorite theme to directory ~/Projects/<site name>/themes Modify your config file baseURL = "https://<URL of your Git Hub Pages>/" languageCode = "en-us" title = "<website name>" theme = "<theme name>" Run hugo server to check if everything in your local host is expected Add Git Hub Pages repository as submodule of your source repository cd ~/Projects/<site name> git submodule add -b main <URL of your Git Hub Pages> public # Generate static resouce in public directory hugo cd public git add .
